resources.string: Warning: this application is protected by copyright law and international treaties. Unauthorized reproduction or distribution of this program, or any part of it, may result in severe civil and criminal penalties, and will be prosecuted to the maximum extent possible under the law.
Send the last 30 minutes of the device log
Send the detailed system information about running processes, installed applications, memory, cpu and battery state
The report description must be at least %s characters long.
The email address is not valid.
The feedback was sent, thank you!
An error occurred, please try again later.
"You can use wildcards to match more than one phone number. Use '*' for any number of digits and '.' for one digit. The number must contain at least 4 digits when you use the wildcards."
The entered number is not in a valid format.
The entered number is too short.
The entered number is an emergency number.
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Suspendisse dapibus sagittis purus, vel facilisis lectus pellentesque eget. Praesent hendrerit odio id nulla semper bibendum.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Suspendisse dapibus sagittis purus, vel facilisis lectus pellentesque eget. Praesent hendrerit odio id nulla semper bibendum. Fusce vitae nisi quam, quis volutpat ligula. Fusce ac enim nisi, quis lobortis ipsum. Nam vel dui arcu, eu pellentesque mi. Sed euismod viverra iaculis. Phasellus ipsum ligula, aliquam vel accumsan tincidunt, fringilla nec lacus. Sed venenatis, erat quis tempus cursus, nisi odio laoreet ipsum, a pharetra est eros nec massa. Nunc fringilla fermentum ligula sed euismod. Pellentesque ut mi ac metus viverra egestas.
A command of this type is already active. Please wait until it is handled.
avast! Internet Control was successfully configured
The internet features are not enabled.
This command cannot be issued via this channel.
Version too low, please upgrade your avast! client.
START: Submission of data is starting...
END: Submission of data is finished.
C2DM is not supported on this phone.
The C2DM sender was not recognized.
Too many applications use C2DM on the device.
Authentication of your Google account failed on the device.
It seems that differently signed avast! Suite packages are installed. All the avast! Suite packages (Anti-Theft, Mobile Security etc.) need to be signed with the same key.
"Server '%s' wants to configure this phone to enable internet remote control."
Do you want to allow this (recommended)?
An error occurred during avast! internet remote control configuration:
"Server '%s' will be configured to enable internet remote control of this phone."
Reboot failed (%s). Retry (it is recommended to retry at least one time)?
Please specify a valid SET command.
The two-way SMS gateway was changed.
PIN for access to all avast! applications on Android.
The PIN can contain only digits because Anti-Theft is launched by dialing the PIN when in disguised mode. The length is constrained because of the possible collisions with real phone numbers.
Please set the recovery phone number in the Settings.
Please connect your device to the avast! Account.

"This will send an SMS with the temporary PIN to the number specified in the PIN recovery settings. The PIN will be valid for 30 minutes.
Do you want to send the SMS?"
The SMS with the temporary PIN was successfully sent.
There was an error and the SMS with the temporary PIN was not sent. Please try again later.

"You've just set the avast! PIN. It's also highly recommended to setup the PIN Recovery number, which may come in handy if you forget your PIN. In that case a temporary PIN is sent to the Recovery number, so you can still access the application."
The PIN Recovery number may come in handy if you forget your PIN. In that case a temporary PIN is sent to the Recovery number, so you can still access the application.
Add files to CyanogenMod custom backup list. This will enable Anti-Theft to survive CyanogenMod ROM flashes. REQUIRES CYANOGEN MOD ROM.
The server replied with error code %s.
The sender of this SMS has requested we send you a new avast! PIN. The new PIN is %s and is valid for up to 30 minutes.
Do you really want to disconnect from your avast! Account?
WARNING: This will delete all your avast! Backup data from our servers!
Enter the avast! Account credentials or create a new account.
Username is not a valid email address.
Phone number is not in a valid format.
Phone number is not international (starts with + or 00). An international format is needed for the avast! account.
This device has a phone number
Setting up phone Google account registration...
The service is temporarily unavailable, please try again later.
The entered password is too short.
The entered email is not valid.
The e-mail or password you have entered is incorrect.
The entered e-mail is already in use.
Authentication failed, there was an internet connection error.
Could not connect to Google Cloud to Device Messaging. Please make sure that your Google account is set up correctly.
Could not connect to Google Cloud to Device Messaging (%s). Please make sure that your Google account is set up correctly.
This device is already registered with a different account. If this is on purpose, please go online and delete your device from your old account, then try again.
Your avast! software version is too low. Please update your avast! tools before registering the device to your account.
The phone number your entered was found to be invalid. Please give a valid phone number.
A server error occurred (%s). Please try again later.
A server error occurred. Please try again later.
Your avast! Anti-Theft installation is too old. Please update avast! Anti-Theft before registering the device to your account
Your avast! Mobile Security installation is too old. Please update avast! Mobile Security before registering the device to your account

You installed avast! Anti-Theft from our servers AND from Google Play. The Google Play installation has been completely disabled and will not work. Please uninstall the Google Play installation of avast! Anti-Theft.

This application version is downloaded from Google Play (simple installation) and can not be used as rooted installation. Remove this installation and use the avast! Mobile Security advanced installation wizard to install avast! Anti-Theft rooted.
Your avast! Backup installation is too old. Please update avast! Backup before registering the device to your account
This device does not support Google Cloud to Device Messaging. This feature is critical to the use of our online portal and requires at least Android 2.2.
Do you want to set up the avast! Account? You can always set it up later in the settings.
Let avast! diagnose potential account connection problems and suggest solutions to fix any found problems
avast! is now diagnosing potential account connection problems...
Waiting for test message from web (%d seconds left)...
The diagnosis process did not find any issues.
There is a mistake in your account settings. Disconnect the device from your avast! account and reconnect it to fix this problem.

Your device has no Google Cloud Messaging ID. It will try to automatically recover it, but an invalid Google Account could prevent the recovery. Disconnect the device from your avast! account and reconnect it to fix this problem.
The Android background data setting is disabled. avast! will not be able to receive messages from the web.
There is no network connection active. avast! is not be able to communicate to the web.
The mobile data connection is disabled. avast! will not work without having the mobile data setting enabled. Please enable this setting.
There is invalid or missing data stored on our servers. Disconnect the device from your avast! account and reconnect it to fix this problem.
Your device was not found on our servers. Disconnect the device from your avast! account and reconnect it to fix this problem.
A server error occurred when sending a message to your device. Please use the feedback button to contact our support.
Google returned an error when trying to send a message to your device. Please use the feedback button to contact our support.
The server delivered an invalid response. Please retry.
We got no Google Cloud Messaging ID stored on our servers. Disconnect the device from your avast! account and reconnect it to fix this problem.
Your device is not registered to the Google Cloud Messaging servers. Disconnect the device from your avast! account and reconnect it to fix this problem.

"The message sent from our servers to your device has not been received. Most of the times this is a temporary issue which can easily be solved by disabling and enabling WiFi again.
We know that sometimes firewalls block ports 5228, 5229 or 5230, which are required for Google Cloud Messaging. Please contact your system or network operator to make sure this is not the case.
Another issue is that you maybe have too old avast! Anti-Theft or avast! Mobile Security versions installed, please try to upgrade all tools to their newest version.
If the problem can not be solved, please use the feedback button to contact our support."
avast! Anti-Theft is not enabled and does not accept commands because of this. Please enable avast! Anti-Theft.
avast! Mobile Security is too old. Please upgrade avast! Mobile Security to the most recent version.
avast! Anti-Theft is too old. Please upgrade avast! Anti-Theft to the most recent version.
avast! Backup is too old. Please upgrade avast! Backup to the most recent version.
The avast! program version is too old. Please upgrade to the most recent version.
Your device was found on our server, but it is marked as archived. Disconnect the device from your avast! account and reconnect it to fix this problem.

Your device was found on our server, but it seems that background communication to our servers does not work. Please make sure your internet connection is stable, then disconnect the device from your avast! account and reconnect it to fix this problem.
Warning: your hard reset proof settings backup is INVALID. After a hard reset avast! Anti-Theft may not work anymore. Please backup your settings hard reset proof again.
Warning: there is NO hard reset proof settings backup existing. After a hard reset your avast! Anti-Theft will not work anymore. Please backup your settings hard reset proof.
Warning: your hard reset proof settings backup is NOT UP TO DATE. After a hard reset your avast! Anti-Theft may not work anymore. Please backup your settings hard reset proof again.
NOT UP TO DATE diagnosis error message: %s.
No issues found. Do you want to show ignored issues? Try to click the button above.
avast! Anti-Theft discovered no issues that should be fixed. Please note that you may have ignored issues, click the button below to show ignored issues.

There is not enough space available on the /system partition of your device (%1$s free, %2$s required). Free up some space by deleting unused (e.g. audio) files from the /system partition using a root file manager
"By tapping the Agree button, you agree to the"
By enabling this option, you are giving your consent to anonymously forward certain security-related information to AVAST
It was not possible to connect to the Google Licensing Service
It was not possible to connect to the Google Licensing Service: %s
There was a timeout preparing the connection to the Google Licensing Service
There was a timeout when checking your license on the Google Licensing Service
An error occurred when validating your license: %s
The license was not accepted by the server twice
An unknown error occurred on the Google Licensing Service servers
It was not possible to connect to the Google Licensing Service servers
The Google Licensing Service servers have denied access to your device
The data returned by the Google Licensing Service is invalid
Could not establish connection to server
Anti-Theft Setup will now check for system dependencies that your phone needs to fulfill in order to use this tool.
The following problems need to be solved before avast! Anti-Theft can be installed. Click on a row to show more options.
Could not connect to the internet.
This device is already protected. Uninstall avast! Anti-Theft before installing this version.
Your current Android settings prevent installation of apps not downloaded from Google Play. Please enable installation of our app in your system settings by checking the Unknown Sources setting.

avast! Anti-Theft is not yet set up. This standalone module of avast! Mobile Security brings the latest anti-theft technology to your device. To setup Anti-Theft on your device, please first select your preferred installation mode.
In the easy installation mode, avast! Anti-Theft is installed with the randomly generated application name %s.
In the advanced installation you can install avast! Anti-Theft as hard-reset proof and choose a custom name to disguise your avast! Anti-Theft installation.
Downloading from Google Play is the easiest way to get Anti-Theft with its default disguised name %s.
avast! Anti-Theft is able to run on your phone as normal installation. Additionally it offers special root features, like making the app hard-reset proof. Please select the desired installation mode.
If you choose to install rooted, avast! Anti-Theft Setup will request super user permissions upon installation.
Install avast! Anti-Theft as hard-reset proof. THIS REQUIRES YOUR PHONE TO BE ROOTED.
In the next step you will choose a name to disguise your avast! Anti-Theft installation. avast! Anti-Theft will be registered to the application manager by using that name.

You will be able to find your avast! Anti-Theft installation by this custom name. The start screen icon will look like below, it is visible until avast! Anti-Theft is ENABLED, at this time the icon will vanish.
You may now choose the name of your disguised avast! Anti-Theft installation. Please choose an unsuspicious name as the name will hide avast! Anti-Theft from the eyes of any thief.
Getting name suggestion from server. Please wait...
Please only use digits and characters for the package name.
Please give a longer package name.
avast! Anti-Theft Setup is now downloading your customized installer package. Please be patient.

Please select your root installation method. On most phones the Direct Write method will work. However, if you are operating on NAND (S-ON) protected devices, you will need to use the Recovery Image method.
Will directly try to write to the system partition. DOES NOT WORK ON NAND (S-ON) PROTECTED DEVICES.
Will generate an UPDATE.ZIP file. Only needed for NAND (S-ON) protected devices. REQUIRES CUSTOM RECOVERY IMAGE.
Please select the UPDATE.ZIP format to generate. EDIFY is for newer ROMS, if it does not work, try to use the old AMEND format instead.

EDIFY scripts depend on a special file called UPDATE BINARY. Try the binary appropriate to your operating system, however it is not guaranteed to work on every recovery system. If it does not work, try the other types one by one until you get a binary that works.
UPDATE.ZIP was created on the SD-card. Do you want to start ROM Manager to flash avast! Anti-Theft in recovery mode?
Could not create UPDATE.ZIP on SD-card (%s). Make sure the SD-card is mounted. Retry?
Could not write to /system directory (%s). Retry (it is recommended to retry at least one time)?
UPDATE.ZIP was created on the SD-card. You are now able to remove the setup utility and to flash avast! Anti-Theft in recovery mode (e.g. by using ROM Manager).
The program file was successfully installed to the system partition. You now have to REBOOT your phone to use avast! Anti-Theft.
Uninstall it and go to the Android Market for the latest version
Below is a list of potential privacy issues. Tap an issue to see the list of affected applications.
The avast! Anti-Theft has to be set up first to work properly. Do you want to set it up now? You can initiate the set up later by pressing Anti-Theft on the Dashboard.
Do you really want to continue?
There is not enough available free space on the internal phone memory.
Read permission has been denied to the avast! virus scanner.
Virus database is too old, please update it from the Settings.
Virus database is not compatible with the application.
Exploit %1$s has been found in a message from %2$s.
Infection %1$s has been found in a message from %2$s.
Message from %1$s has been marked as suspicious, because of %2$s.
Mistyped url has been found in a message from %s.
Phishing url has been found in a message from %s.
Mistyped and phishing urls have been found in a message from %s.
Please wait, report upload is still in progress…
Not enough space to create the submit in internal memory. Free up some space and try again.
Connection to the server failed. Check your Internet connectivity and try again.
The file to be sent was not found. Try running the virus scan again.
"The file to be sent could not be accessed. Private files can't be submitted."
Please fill in the description before submitting the report.
These apps can track your location.
These apps can read your mobile number, serial number or other data.
These apps can access your SMS and MMS messages.
These apps can access your contact list.
These apps can access your accounts.
These apps can access secure settings.
These apps can access web pages you open.

Access coarse location sources such as the cellular network database to determine an approximate location, where available. Malicious applications can use this to determine approximately where you are.
Access fine location sources such as the Global Positioning System, where available. Malicious applications can use this to determine where you are, and may consume additional battery power.

Allows an application to access the phone features of the device. An application with this permission can determine the phone number and serial number of this phone, whether a call is active, the number that call is connected to etc.
Allows an application to read SMS messages stored on your device or SIM card. Malicious applications may read your confidential messages.
Allows an application to receive and process SMS messages. Malicious applications may monitor your messages or delete them without showing them to you.
Allows an application to receive and process MMS messages. Malicious applications may monitor your messages or delete them without showing them to you.
Allows an application to send SMS messages. Malicious applications may cost you money by sending messages without your confirmation.
Allows an application to write to SMS messages stored on your device or SIM card. Malicious applications may delete your messages.
Allows an application to receive and process WAP messages. Malicious applications may monitor your messages or delete them without showing them to you.
Allows an application to read all of the contact (address) data stored on your tablet. Malicious applications can use this to send your data to other people.
Allows an application to modify the contact (address) data stored on your device. Malicious applications can use this to erase or modify your contact data.
Use the authentication credentials of an account
Allows an application to request authentication credentials.
Allows an application to perform operations such as adding, and removing accounts and deleting their password.
Allows an application to use the account authenticator capabilities of the AccountManager, including creating accounts and getting and setting their passwords.
Allows an application to make calls to AccountAuthenticators
"Allows an application to modify the system's secure settings data. Not for use by normal applications."
Allows an application to open web links or react to opened links in another way.
You have no filter groups yet.
"You have no contacts in this group yet."
Please note that it might not be possible to block some short and character numbers.
Here is the last %s months of your incoming calls grouped by the callers and sorted by the date.
On LG devices with Android 2.3+ it is not possible to block incomming calls
Checks for blocked incoming calls and adds them to the list of blocked calls.
An application tried to execute an USSD code, which is very likely intended to harm your system. avast! Mobile Security blocked execution of this code.
Incoming message from an unknown number \"%s\"
Do you want to block all messages from this number from now on?
Window with a \"block\" button will be shown for messages from unknown numbers
This application has no privacy issues.
This application does not have a screen with details.
Enables/disables the shield with all its parts.

"Web Shield protects you against the risks that you are exposed to while browsing the Web.
It integrates with multiple browsers (%1$s) and alerts you whenever you navigate to a malicious or phishing site. %2$s"

"
(Experimental support for Dolphin Browser Mini is disabled. If you want to enable it, uninstall both Dolphin Browser Mini and avast! Mobile Security and install avast! Mobile Security again, before installing Dolphin Browser Mini.)"

"
(Experimental support for Dolphin Browser Mini is enabled.)"
You have to install the Firefox Add-On when using Firefox. Also note that SiteCorrect is not supported for Firefox at the moment.
Download and install the avast! Firefox Web Shield Add-On. This action must be performed within Firefox (only available if Firefox is installed).
This website has been reported as malicious.
This website has been reported as a phishing site.
This website has been reported as suspicious.
Do you really want to open it?

Firefox was detected on your mobile phone. If you want to use Web Shield for Firefox, you have to install the avast! Firefox Web Shield Add-On. IN EACH CASE, every time when enabling Web Shield, you have to RESTART Firefox to enable the Add-On to detect the change.
Firefox was restarted. Make sure you have the avast! Firefox Web Shield Add-On installed.

"This feature requires root access as it is not possible to realize meaningful firewall features without root access.
Current firewall mode: %s"
Not able to disable firewall because of PIN protection.
The following apps have been blocked by the firewall. This list only contains access attempts for a limited time period. It will be refreshed every 30 seconds.
Your operating system kernel does not support netfilter, so the avast! firewall will not work. To solve this, flash a custom ROM with full netfilter support.
Your operating system kernel does not support IPv6. The IPv6 setting was now disabled automatically. Please retry.
Calling the IPv6 stack failed. Most likely your operating system kernel does not support IPv6. It is recommended to retry enabling IPv6 at least once to make sure that this is not a timeout issue.
Failed to clear the firewall rules.

"Could not acquire root access. You need a rooted phone to run the avast! firewall.
If this phone is already rooted, please make sure the avast! firewall has enough permissions to execute the SU command."
Error installing avast! firewall binary files: %s.
Unable to enable the avast! firewall.
Roaming state changed, but cannot apply avast! firewall rules.
If enabled, the firewall will log recent blocked traffic stats. THE LOG WILL BE CUT OFF AUTOMATICALLY AFTER A FEW MINUTES.
Let avast! firewall rules take highest priority. This is useful if the firewall does not work on your phone when enabling the Android mobile data limit.
The file /system/bin/ipv6tables was not found or could not be read. It is necessary for IPv6 support.
If enabled, firewall rules will also be applied to the IPv6 stack of the phone.
Custom rules are applied in the order appearing in this list. Custom rules override all the other app-related firewall rules.
You have no custom rules yet.
The port value is invalid, please give a value from 1 to 65535.
The given IP address is invalid.
The given netmask address is invalid.
Please select at least one connection type.
Please select at least one rule type.
This feature requires Android 2.2 or above. In the previous Android versions, the necessary APIs to gather traffic statistics are not present.
Unfortunately, your phone does not support gathering of traffic statistics. The feature cannot be enabled.
Also includes low level system traffic which is not associated with the apps below
Enables the network meter service. The statistics are updated every ten minutes.
Disabling the network meter service will clear all the existing statistics. Do you really want to disable the service?
"Select a day in the month to reset monthly and yearly statistics, e.g. if you want to adjust to your operator's billing period."
Changing this value will clear all the existing statistics. Do you really want to continue?
Please note that any change you make on this screen is related only to this application.
Application locking text password can contain digits and letters.

On LG devices with the default launcher, it is not possible to lock uninstall of any application. You need to use a 3rd party launcher if you want to lock uninstall. Locking of running apps is fully working on your device.
Tap to edit settings related to automatic updates of virus definitions.
Allow automatic updates only for free wifi networks, mobile networks and roaming
Enable when background data is off

Disabling the PIN protection of avast! Mobile Security is not recommended while avast! Anti-Theft is installed as this reduces the security of Anti-Theft if your phone is lost or stolen. Do you really want to disable the PIN protection now?
Disabling the PIN protection will disable the Application locking feature. Do you really want to disable the PIN protection now?
Notification icon is important for the security of the device.

"You are about to turn off the avast! notification icon.
The notification icon helps avast! protect your device better.
Are you sure you want to turn it off?"
Treat Potentially Unwanted Programs (PUP) as malware
Save Activity Log to a file
Save complete Activity Log to the file on the external storage
Keep the CPU running while scanning for viruses after the device has been put asleep
Tap to manage the connection of avast! Mobile Security (and other AVAST products) to your avast! Account.
Report program status to the avast! Account
avast! PIN is required in order to uninstall any application (PIN protection needs to be enabled)
Your PIN will be required %s after leaving the app.
avast! Anti-Theft is not yet set up. This great anti-theft program is a standalone module of avast! Mobile Security and brings the latest technology in anti-theft to your device.
You can now start the Anti-Theft setup process which will guide you through the set up.
Connection to the update server failed. Check your Internet connectivity and try again.
An unknown error occurred. Please, try again later.
The downloaded virus definitions were invalid. Please, try again later.
Not enough space in the internal device memory to perform the update. Please, free up some space and try again.
"Your application version doesn't support the newest virus definitions. Please, update your application to keep receiving virus definitions updates."
avast! Anti-Theft must not be set as a device administrator. Please remove the device administrator setting.
The device admin screen could not be detected. Please remove the setting manually in your phone settings.
avast! Mobile Security will now check if you need to do anything else before uninstalling avast! Anti-Theft.
The following problems need to be solved before avast! Anti-Theft can be uninstalled:

Please select your root uninstallation method. On most phones the Direct Write method will work. However, if you are using a NAND (S-ON) protected device, you will need to use the Recovery Image method.
UPDATE.ZIP was created on the SD-card. Do you want to start ROM Manager to uninstall in recovery mode?
Will try to delete directly from the system partition. DOES NOT WORK ON NAND (S-ON) PROTECTED DEVICES.
The program file was successfully uninstalled from the system partition.
UPDATE.ZIP was created on the SD-card. You are now able to remove the program by flashing in recovery mode (e.g. by using ROM Manager).
"Fixes spelling errors when you type an address to the browser's address bar."
If the box is unchecked, you will be asked what to do when a mistyped address is detected.
This is probably not the site you were trying to enter. Did you mean %s?
Automatically correct mistyped urls from now on
Enables/disables the shield with all its parts.
Scans incoming messages (SMS) for viruses, phishing, malicious and mistyped urls.
Also helps you to block incoming messages from unknown numbers.
Enables/disables the shield with all its parts.
Scans applications for viruses on their installation and execution.
Enables/disables the shield with all its parts.
"Scans the files on the device's storage when they are used."
Scan the whole storage when mounting
Attempt to update the virus definitions failed, next attempt: %s.
Your definitions are up to date with the server.
Granted access to avast! Mobile Security based on inserted PIN.
SiteCorrect automatically redirected mistyped address to correct site: %s.
Scanned %1$s files in the last %2$s minutes.
Below is a list of various add-ons that applications may contain. Tap an add-on to see the list of applications that contain it.
Notify me about installed applications with this add-on.
This is a potentially unwanted add-on.
This add-on shows text or graphical banners as well as full-screen advertisements.
This add-on is capable of showing animated banners, popups and full-screen advertisements. Applications requiring installation from unknown sources can be downloaded by tapping on a banner.
cn. Capable of displaying in-app advertisements as banners or splash screens, and full-screen advertisements in built-in browser.
This add-on is usually found in freemium or free-to-play games providing ways to get in-game currency or virtual items and displaying advertisements.
Capable of showing animated in-app banners of various sizes. A call to the advertised phone number might be initiated after clicking on a banner.
Shows animated or video adverts in various sizes sliding in and out from screen borders. Adverts resize to full-screen after tapping.
This add-on can include a virtual marketplace with actions to complete to gain rewards or premium features. May also include banners and full-screen/video advertisements.

Capable of playing an advertisement video before, during or after interaction with the app. Can also contain animated banners resizing themselves after a tap, or full-screen advertisements the user might need to interact with to continue using the app.

While waiting for a call to connect, an advertisement is played instead of the connecting sound. After the call is done, a full-screen advertisement can be shown to request a response to the previously played advertisement.

Displays full-screen advertisements usually between different app screens or during a background operation like a file download. The user can opt-out for different campaigns in the advertisement screens.

Apart from showing or playing banners, video, audio and full-screen advertisements inside the application, this add-on is also capable of pushing advertisements into the notification area of your device.
This add-on can show banners, full-screen advertisements and promotional videos usually during application startup or data loading.
Creates a new home screen icon after being granted permission to do so. The icon leads to a games and apps advertising site.
Shows automatically changing banners sliding from screen borders. The add-on can directly make phone calls after tapping the banner if allowed by the app developer.
Developed by Google Inc, creator of Android OS.
This add-on is capable of showing banners, full-screen advertisements and clickable advertisement images.
Apart from the usual in-app banners, this add-on can also push advertisements to the notification area of your device as well as place advertisement icons on your home screen.
This add-on intergrates various ad networks. Advertisements shown can range from simple banners to advertisements initiating calls to predetermined phone numbers.
Shows auto-refreshing banners, full-screen advertisements and video promotions. Advertisements might be localized to the language of the app or the system.
This add-on is used to provide behaviour tracking data to the developers of the applications. This can include privacy information if the app requests respective permissions.

Add-on capable of displaying animated banners, in-app popup advertisements as well as full-screen advertisements. Advertisements are cached on the device so they might be shown even without an Internet connection.

Add-on containing both analytical and advertising content. Can send the developers information about user behaviour inside the app as well as crash reports. Various advertisements might also be shown in the app.
Developed by Google Inc, creator of Android OS.
This add-on sends the application developer information about user interaction with the application. Capable of sending crash reports and device information to the developer.
Shows (animated) banners, full-screen advertisements, promotional videos or pop-ups encouraging app download. Advertisements can be based on your current location.
Add-on showing animated banners usually at the bottom of the screen. After tapping the banner, a full-screen advertisement is shown.
This add-on integrates various advertisement networks. Can display banners, custom-shaped and full-screen advertisements, and is capable of displaying them in built-in browser.
Displays static or sliding banners, animated content and video promotions. Banners can expand on tap to show more content.
This add-on has the ability to show in-app banners and can push advertisements to the notification area of your device.
Add-on integrating numerous other advertisement networks. Shows advertisements in the form of banners of various sizes and full-screen promotions.
Developed by MobFox Mobile Advertising GmbH.
Capable of displaying banners of various sizes (larger ones on tablets) and video promotions during app load screens.
Shows advertisements in the form of static and animated banners as well as promotional videos. The videos can be displayed at any time while interacting with the app.

Apart from displaying advertisement banners or lists of advertised applications to install, this add-on can also push advertisement notifications, create home screen icons and alter stock browser bookmarks.
net. Capable of showing advertisement banners and full-screen advertisements with items to complete to acquire in-app points.
Add-on showing banner advertisements that might expand to an animated full-screen promotion or play a video upon tapping.

"Applications built using Plankton (also known as Apperhand) can send privacy-related information (including IMEI, device brand, model, operating system, OS version) to developer's server, push advertisement notifications to the notification area of your device, add bookmarks to the stock browser and place promotional icons on your homescreen."

This add-on integrates various advertisement providers allowing them to present their ads as tappable/expandable banners, video promotions and full-screen advertisements. Upon tapping the banner, a phone call can be initiated or a position on Google Maps can be shown.

Add-on integrating both advertisement providers and analytic add-ons. Apart from showing banners, full-screen advertisements and video promotions, can also include reporting of user behavior inside the application as well as overall application statistics.
Apart from static/expandable banners and videos can also show full-screen promotions with animated content. Tapping on an advert can result in a website load, Google Play link or social network post.
Add-on showing static or animated banners that usually expand to full-screen on tap. Possibility of playing a promotional video in the full-screen advert.
Shows rich media advertisements like animated banners and promotional videos. The advertisements can be customized based on your device information.
